definitions: not showing emotion; having one's feelings under control

examples.text: his every word seemed to be calm and controlled
she's a very controlled player and is mentally tough

definitions: under the control of someone or something

examples.text: the country's tightly controlled financial markets

definitions: having been limited in intensity or level; kept in check

examples.text: the office was in a state of controlled chaos

definitions: (of a drug) restricted by law with respect to use and possession

examples.text: a sentence for possessing controlled substances

definitions: (of an explosion) produced deliberately under conditions that are determined beforehand

examples.text: bomb disposal experts carried out a controlled explosion on the suspicious object

shortDefinitions: (of explosion) produced deliberately under determined conditions

definitions: (of an experiment, test, etc.) carried out under conditions that preclude error or the influence of extraneous factors

examples.text: the first randomized controlled trial to study the effects of copper bracelets on rheumatoid arthritis

shortDefinitions: (of experiment) carried out under conditions that preclude error
